main event: Several military personnel observed a bright, oval-shaped object moving rapidly across the sky over Naha, Okinawa on October 6, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed to move in a straight line and then make a sharp 90-degree turn before disappearing from view.
The object was described as larger than a star and brighter than the surrounding stars.
The sighting was made by trained and experienced military observers under clear night sky conditions.
Multiple photographs were taken of the object, though the quality is unclear.
The sighting was investigated and officially classified as an 'unidentified' flying object.
